channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: This is BBC Four
channel.desc: Programmes start at 7.00pm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Penguin Post Office
channel.desc: Nature documentary looking at a post office in Antarctica that is surrounded by 3,000 gentoo penguins.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Mirror Crack'd
channel.desc: The quiet English village of St Mary Mead is disrupted when a Hollywood film crew introduce inflated egos and cold-blooded murder. Miss Marple, of course, investigates.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Angela Lansbury at the NFT
channel.desc: In a programme first broadcast in 1973, actress Angela Lansbury talks to American columnist Rex Reed and answers questions from members of the audience at London's National Film Theatre.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mercury Prize 2025
channel.desc: Lauren Laverne hosts the Mercury Prize 2025 from Newcastle's Utilita Arena, celebrating each of the 12 shortlisted Albums of the Year before announcing the overall winner.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Blues Brothers
channel.desc: Jake Blues and his brother Elwood have just days to save the home where they were raised. Contains very strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: How to Get Ahead at Renaissance Court
channel.desc: Stephen Smith explores Renaissance Florence under the reign of Grand Duke Cosimo Medici, where some of the greatest painters, sculptors and craftsmen in world history served.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Angela Lansbury at the NFT
channel.desc: In a programme first broadcast in 1973, actress Angela Lansbury talks to American columnist Rex Reed and answers questions from members of the audience at London's National Film Theatre.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Blood and Gold
channel.desc: Spain with Simon Sebag Montefiore. 2/3. Simon uncovers the truth about El Cid and investigates the Spanish Inquisition.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Magic Roundabout Story
channel.desc: A celebration of the classic children's series. Created in Paris in the early 1960s, The Magic Roundabout was brought to the British screen by actor Eric Thompson.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Magic Roundabout
channel.desc: Classic trippy animation from the Swinging Sixties. Florence and Brian help Dougal search for a four-leaf clover.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: Siegfried and James are left to Calum's cooking while their wives visit London. James meets Basil Courtenay, a rather upper-class cowhand.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: James renews his acquaintance with an old farmer called Mr Potts, whose unfortunate demise coincides with that of King George VI.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Intruder
channel.desc: Paula is arrested on suspicion of murder. Having apprehended some long-held secrets, Jerome decides he wants a divorce, as Tess continues to weave her web in the family home.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Intruder
channel.desc: Paula is on Tess's trail, locating the places where she grew up. Contains some strong language and some violent scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Parkinson
channel.desc: Michael Parkinson in conversation with Patricia Routledge, Morgan Freeman and Gary Lineker.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: The Goods find new ways to put their loom to good use, while Margo and Jerry are preparing for an important dinner party at which Jerry's boss will announce his retirement.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes, Prime Minister
channel.desc: Hacker prepares to make his first broadcast as prime minister, announcing his grand new defence policy, but he finds it is not so easy to speak on camera.

channel.desc: Siegfried and James are left to Calum's cooking while their wives visit London. James meets Basil Courtenay, a rather upper-class cowhand.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: African Penguin
channel.desc: Documentary following pioneering young penguins as they invade a busy South African beach resort in an attempt to establish a new colony.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Jane Goodall
channel.desc: Film about Jane Goodall, whose work with chimps transformed our understanding of them. Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Wogan with Jane Goodall, Ade Edmondson and Eurythmics
channel.desc: Terry Wogan talks to Jane Goodall and Adrian Edmondson, with music by Eurythmics.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: A Choral Pilgrimage with The Sixteen
channel.desc: Luminous choral music on the theme of peace performed by one of the world's finest choirs in the glorious Peterborough Cathedral. Presented by Hannah French.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Lord Mervyn King Remembers... The Age of Uncertainty
channel.desc: Former governor of the Bank of England Mervyn King looks back on the BBC's 1977 series on the history of economic thinking, The Age of Uncertainty.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Age of Uncertainty
channel.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith tells the story of the men who laid the foundations of economics, including Adam Smith, David Ricardo and Thomas Malthus.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Age of Uncertainty
channel.desc: Professor Galbraith looks at the ideas that sustained the rich in the 19th century and how they still affect our attitudes today.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Philip Pullman
channel.desc: Delve into the world of Philip Pullman and explore the author's own dark materials.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
channel.desc: Fred Dibnah indulges his personal passion for the achievements of the builders of the 19th century.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
channel.desc: The next batch of wannabe shuttle drivers has just arrived for the first round of testing.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Stolen
channel.desc: The theft of two Turners on loan from the Tate in 1994 starts a high-stakes game of cat and mouse across Europe from London to Belgrade, deep into the world of Serbian war lords.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Call My Bluff
channel.desc: Robert Robinson presides as Frank Muir, Jilly Cooper and Prof Quentin Bell compete with Patrick Campbell, Lesley Ann Down and Anthony Valentine in a duel of words and wit.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face the Music
channel.desc: Question master Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Patricia Owen, John Julius Norwich and David Attenborough. With guest musician Imogen Cooper.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bette Davis
channel.desc: Documentary about Hollywood star Bette Davis, spanning her life and career from the 1920s to the 1980s, on stage and on screen, including an interview with the actress herself.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Art and Design
channel.desc: Writer George Melly talks about the influence of surrealism on his early life. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Great Philosophers
channel.desc: Bryan Magee and Bernard Williams discuss the work of French philosopher Ren? Descartes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Great Philosophers
channel.desc: Bryan Magee discusses the work of Dutch philosopher Baruch Spinoza and Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz, the German philosopher, with his guest, Anthony Quinton.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
channel.desc: The story of a year in the life of Bodnant Garden in north Wales, and how it is being revamped with the aim of making it one of the top ten gardens in the world.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers
channel.desc: Keeping Up Appearances. Dame Patricia recalls how the character of Hyacinth Bucket first entered her life.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Keeping Up Appearances
channel.desc: Hyacinth is in a sunny disposition, which mystifies Richard. The real horror of his situation dawns on him when he realises that he has forgotten their anniversary.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers
channel.desc: Miss Pym's Day Out. Dame Patricia recalls Miss Pym's Day Out, in which she portrayed author Barbara Pym.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Pym's Day Out
channel.desc: Dramatised documentary about the writer Barbara Pym, depicting one day in her life - 23 November 1977 - when she travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers
channel.desc: Talking Heads. Dame Patricia discusses her roles in Alan Bennett's acclaimed series of tele-plays.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Talking Heads
channel.desc: Drama monologue by Alan Bennett. Irene Ruddock lives alone. Her habit of writing letters to the appropriate authorities gets ridiculously out of hand.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Britain's Wild Places
channel.desc: How thousands of strange nocturnal birds make their home on the island of Bardsey in north Wales, and an exploration of the history of the island itself.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Sanatorium - Storyville
channel.desc: Storyville documentary. A bittersweet and surreal summer unfolds inside a crumbling Soviet-era wellness resort in Odesa, where guests seek healing, love and distraction.
